item.title: Report E-2024040062
item.description:
Report E-2024040062

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) one-gallon pail of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pail was placed inside one (1) 5-gallon bucked and all impacted cardboard and absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal. The remaining, undamaged packages were repalletized for shipping.

item.title: Report E-2024040045
item.description:
Report E-2024040045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Dallas, TX. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Unisol Liquid Red B (UN1307), which released from a 55 gallon metal drum due to a piece of metal from the trailer puncturing the bottom of the drum, causing a slow leak onto the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbent, and will place the contents into an 85 gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040002
item.description:
Report E-2024040002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and one (1) gallon to the underneath of the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH patched the metal drum and placed it into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpacked drum. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the interior of the trailer and pavement below to absorb the paint. LSH swept all paint impacted absorbents with hand tools and containerized them to one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Utilizing degreaser, LSH wiped off impacted surfaces of the cargo shipment and contained all remaining debris absorbent pads and utilized PPE into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. LSH generated two (2) 55-gallon poly drums worth of non-hazardous waste, and one (1) 95- gallon overpacked poly drum of hazardous waste. All waste generated was labeled appropriately and staged onsite for further handling.

item.title: Report E-2024030607
item.description:
Report E-2024030607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20 ounces of CARBOTHANE 8815 PART A released from a 5-gallon metal drum due to a pinhole puncture in the bottom rim. The release impacted the concrete dock and pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on site.
